comments.body: @gnufied I think this is a future cleanup we should think about. Testing allowexpansion field is mainly testing the admission controller and not the actual driver, so I'm not sure we really need to test the volume expansion disallowed case in the driver testsuite. We should just use the driver test capability to determine if run the test or not.

comments.body: csi is not supported on windows yet. This will probably break windows tests?
I just added it for the sake of completeness. It's not used anywhere yet.

They are set [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/78000/files/e1766d849f7a3f1b026dc6dab3c1d56924a63345#diff-d0730f0603544b8d52ced961dc69ddf2R215) to define test patterns for 'volume expansion case' to make their `bindingMode` `storagev1.VolumeBindingWaitForFirstConsumer`. According to  [your comment](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77317#discussion_r280271254)

Let's open up a separate issue to discuss this further but I want to move away from being able to toggle/customize StorageClass arguments in the framework tests.  Now that these tests are also used externally by CSI driver developers, I see a use case where a vendor wants to test their plugin with specific recommended/default storage classes that they provide.

And in some cases, toggling these parameters automatically in the test suite may not work for the storage plugin.  For example, immediate binding mode is not going to work in a multi-zone cluster.  It would be better in this case if the vendor can completely control all the parameters instead of the test suite.
